serinfo.issue: 2006 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract: Canada Indian Reserves represents the Indian Reserves within Canada. The Indian Reserves are based on the National Atlas Information Service (NAIS) 1:2 million digital maps created by Natural Resources Canada for publishing of the National Atlas of Canada.
descript.purpose: Canada Indian Reserves provides Indian Reserves with detail appropriate for national, regional, and provincial levels.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,000,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact Technical Support by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

browse.browsed: Thumbnail image of shapefile in full extent

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.3.0.800

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

citeinfo.title: Canadian Data BundleData set from National Atlas Information Service (NAIS) 1:2 million by Natural Resources Canada.
citeinfo.othercit: This data set is based on the National Atlas Information Service (NAIS) 1:2 million digital maps created by Natural Resources Canada for publishing of the National Atlas of Canada.

procstep.procdesc: The data set is a fully georeferenced, purely digital product. The Indian Reserves are based on the National Atlas Information Service (NAIS) 1:2 million digital maps created by Natural Resources Canada for publishing of the National Atlas of Canada. The Indian Reserves have been attributed with feature name and feature type.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data set from DMTI Spatial Canadian Data Bundle. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added SQKM attribute and calculated its values.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the Indian Reserves of Canada.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The name of the Indian Reserve.
The measure of area in square kilometers.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
